description: The Bing Search API enables developers to embed search results in applications or websites. Add search functionality to a website, create unique consumer or enterprise apps, or develop new mash-ups.

blocks.name: advacedSearch
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to get back a list of relevant data.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: query
args.info: The user's search query string.

args.name: market
args.info: The market where the results come from. Typically, this is the country where the user is making the request from; however, it could be a different country if the user is not located in a country where Bing delivers results. The market must be in the form -. For example, en-US.

args.name: safeSearch
args.info: A filter used to filter results for adult content. Possible values: Off — Return webpages with adult text, images, or videos. Moderate — Return webpages with adult text; however, the articles will not include adult images or videos. Strict — Do not return webpages with adult text, images, or videos. Default is Moderate

args.name: textDecorations
args.info: A Boolean value that determines whether query terms in the response strings will include hit highlighting characters. If true, the strings will include highlighting characters; otherwise, false. The default is false.

args.name: textFormat
args.info: The type of formatting to apply to displayable strings. The following are the possible values: Raw—Use special Unicode characters, E000 and E001, to highlight the query terms; HTML—Use HTML `<b>` tags to highlight the query terms. The default is Raw. To enable or disable hit highlighting, set the textDecorations query parameter.

args.name: responseFilter
args.info: A comma-delimited list of answers to include in the response. If you do not specify this parameter, the response will include all search answers for which there's data. Possible values: Computation, Images, News, RelatedSearches, SpellSuggestions, TimeZone, Videos, Webpages

args.name: count
args.info: The number of news results to return in the response. The actual number delivered may be less than requested.

args.name: offset
args.info: The zero-based offset that indicates the number of news results to skip before returning results.

blocks.name: searchWeb
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to get back a list of relevant webpages.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: query
args.info: The user's search query string.

args.name: market
args.info: The market where the results come from. Typically, this is the country where the user is making the request from; however, it could be a different country if the user is not located in a country where Bing delivers results. The market must be in the form -. For example, en-US.

args.name: safeSearch
args.info: A filter used to filter results for adult content. Possible values: Off — Return webpages with adult text, images, or videos. Moderate — Return webpages with adult text; however, the articles will not include adult images or videos. Strict — Do not return webpages with adult text, images, or videos. Default is Moderate

args.name: textDecorations
args.info: A Boolean value that determines whether query terms in the response strings will include hit highlighting characters. If true, the strings will include highlighting characters; otherwise, false. The default is false.

args.name: textFormat
args.info: The type of formatting to apply to displayable strings. The following are the possible values: Raw—Use special Unicode characters, E000 and E001, to highlight the query terms; HTML—Use HTML `<b>` tags to highlight the query terms. The default is Raw. To enable or disable hit highlighting, set the textDecorations query parameter.

args.name: count
args.info: The number of news results to return in the response. The actual number delivered may be less than requested.

args.name: offset
args.info: The zero-based offset that indicates the number of news results to skip before returning results.

blocks.name: searchImage
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to get back a list of relevant images.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: query
args.info: The user's search query string.

args.name: market
args.info: The market where the results come from. Typically, this is the country where the user is making the request from; however, it could be a different country if the user is not located in a country where Bing delivers results. The market must be in the form -. For example, en-US.

args.name: safeSearch
args.info: A filter used to filter results for adult content. Possible values: Off — Return webpages with adult text, images, or videos. Moderate — Return webpages with adult text; however, the articles will not include adult images or videos. Strict — Do not return webpages with adult text, images, or videos. Default is Moderate

args.name: textDecorations
args.info: A Boolean value that determines whether query terms in the response strings will include hit highlighting characters. If true, the strings will include highlighting characters; otherwise, false. The default is false.

args.name: textFormat
args.info: The type of formatting to apply to displayable strings. The following are the possible values: Raw—Use special Unicode characters, E000 and E001, to highlight the query terms; HTML—Use HTML `<b>` tags to highlight the query terms. The default is Raw. To enable or disable hit highlighting, set the textDecorations query parameter.

args.name: aspect
args.info: Filter images by aspect ratio. The following are the possible filter values: Square — Return images with standard aspect ratio; Wide — Return images with wide screen aspect ratio; Tall — Return images with tall aspect ratio; All — Do not filter by aspect. Specifying this value is the same as not specifying the aspect parameter.

args.name: color
args.info: Filter images by color. The following are the possible filter values: ColorOnly — Return color images, Monochrome — Return black and white images, Black, Blue, Brown, Gray, Green, Orange, Pink, Purple, Red, Teal, White, Yellow

args.name: imageContent
args.info: Filter images by content. The following are the possible filter values: Face — Return images that show only a person's face; Portrait — Return images that show only a person's head and shoulders

args.name: size
args.info: Filter images by size. The following are the possible filter values: Small — Return images that are less than 200x200 pixels; Medium — Return images that are greater than or equal to 200x200 pixels but less than 500x500 pixels; Large — Return images that are 500x500 pixels or larger; Wallpaper — Return wallpaper images; All — Do not filter by size. Specifying this value is the same as not specifying the size parameter.

args.name: height
args.info: Filter images that have the specified height, in pixels.

args.name: width
args.info: Filter images that have the specified width, in pixels.

args.name: imageType
args.info: Filter images by image type. The following are the possible filter values: AnimatedGif — Return only animated GIFs; Clipart — Return only clip art images; Line — Return only line drawings; Photo — Return only photographs (excluding line drawings, animated Gifs, and clip art); Shopping — Return only images that contain items where Bing knows of a merchant that is selling the items.

args.name: count
args.info: The number of news results to return in the response. The actual number delivered may be less than requested.

args.name: offset
args.info: The zero-based offset that indicates the number of news results to skip before returning results.

blocks.name: searchVideo
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to get back a list of relevant videos.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: query
args.info: The user's search query string.

args.name: market
args.info: The market where the results come from. Typically, this is the country where the user is making the request from; however, it could be a different country if the user is not located in a country where Bing delivers results. The market must be in the form -. For example, en-US.

args.name: safeSearch
args.info: A filter used to filter results for adult content. Possible values: Off — Return webpages with adult text, images, or videos. Moderate — Return webpages with adult text; however, the articles will not include adult images or videos. Strict — Do not return webpages with adult text, images, or videos. Default is Moderate

args.name: textDecorations
args.info: A Boolean value that determines whether query terms in the response strings will include hit highlighting characters. If true, the strings will include highlighting characters; otherwise, false. The default is false.

args.name: textFormat
args.info: The type of formatting to apply to displayable strings. The following are the possible values: Raw—Use special Unicode characters, E000 and E001, to highlight the query terms; HTML—Use HTML `<b>` tags to highlight the query terms. The default is Raw. To enable or disable hit highlighting, set the textDecorations query parameter.

args.name: videoLength
args.info: Filter videos by length. The following are the possible filter values: Short — Return videos that are less than 5 minutes; Medium — Return videos that are between 5 and 20 minutes, inclusive; Long — Return videos that are longer than 20 minutes; All — Do not filter by length. Specifying this value is the same as not specifying the videoLength parameter.

args.name: resolution
args.info: Filter videos by resolution. The following are the possible filter values: 480p — Return videos with a 480p or higher resolution; 720p — Return videos with a 720p or higher resolution; 1080p — Return videos with a 1080p or higher resolution; All — Do not filter by resolution. Specifying this value is the same as not specifying the resolution parameter.

args.name: count
args.info: The number of news results to return in the response. The actual number delivered may be less than requested.

args.name: offset
args.info: The zero-based offset that indicates the number of news results to skip before returning results.

blocks.name: searchNews
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to get back a list of relevant news.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: query
args.info: The user's search query string.

args.name: market
args.info: The market where the results come from. Typically, this is the country where the user is making the request from; however, it could be a different country if the user is not located in a country where Bing delivers results. The market must be in the form -. For example, en-US.

args.name: safeSearch
args.info: A filter used to filter results for adult content. Possible values: Off — Return webpages with adult text, images, or videos. Moderate — Return webpages with adult text; however, the articles will not include adult images or videos. Strict — Do not return webpages with adult text, images, or videos. Default is Moderate

args.name: textDecorations

To enable or disable hit highlighting, set the textDecorations query parameter.

args.name: category
args.info: The category of articles to return. For example, Sports articles or Entertainment articles. For a list of possible categories, see News Categories by Market (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn760793.aspx#categoriesbymarket).

args.name: count
args.info: The number of news results to return in the response. The actual number delivered may be less than requested.

args.name: offset
args.info: The zero-based offset that indicates the number of news results to skip before returning results.
